rooms.name: Entryway & Foyer
rooms.description: A small space to welcome guests and allow for a transitional area that adheres to Vastu principles by aligning the main entrance with the positive energy flow. It includes storage and hooks.

rooms.name: Living & Kitchen Combined Space
rooms.description: An open-plan space blending living area and kitchen. Designed for family interaction, adheres to Vastu by placing the cooking area in the southeast corner while ensuring ample natural light from windows.

rooms.name: Master Bedroom & Bathroom
rooms.description: A private master bedroom with an attached small bathroom. The bed is placed according to Vastu for optimum sleep quality, and the window positions are chosen to maximize natural light without direct exposure of the bed to door.

rooms.name: Additional Bedroom & Bathroom
rooms.description: A secondary bedroom for children with an attached bathroom. Room layout follows Vastu principles by placing water elements (bath) in a direction that ensures calm energy.

rooms.name: Multipurpose Utility/Storage Space
rooms.description: Space to serve as a utility room, storage area, or extra workspace. It incorporates local norms by providing built-in cabinets and minimalistic design, making optimal use of limited space.

openings.name: Main Entrance
openings.description: Aligned per Vastu principles, the main entrance is placed in the north or east direction to ensure a flow of positive energy. It includes a small foyer area and is designed for easy access.

openings.name: Windows
openings.description: Strategically placed windows across rooms to maximize natural light. Placement adheres to Vastu guidelines by avoiding direct exposure of the bed and cooking areas.

openings.name: Balcony/Outdoor Patio
openings.description: A small balcony that connects to the living area, offering outdoor space while following local design norms. Its orientation is chosen based on Vastu recommendations for family relaxation.

openings.name: Service Entrance
openings.description: A secondary entrance designed to handle deliveries and service needs, ensuring minimal disturbance to the living areas. It is located away from primary entrances per local norms.
